explanations.machine learning: The paper uses deep learning algorithms for emotion classification, which is a subset of machine learning.
explanations.deep learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of deep learning algorithms for EEG-based emotion classification.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on valence-arousal classification of emotions using EEG data.
explanations.neural network: The proposed hybrid neural architecture integrates a CNN-BiLSTM model, which is a type of neural network.
explanations.convolutional neural network: The paper uses a CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) as part of the hybrid neural architecture.
explanations.CNN: The paper uses a CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) as part of the hybrid neural architecture.
explanations.recurrent neural network: The paper uses a BiLSTM (Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory) model, which is a type of recurrent neural network.
explanations.long short-term memory: The paper uses a BiLSTM (Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory) model.
explanations.LSTM: The paper uses a BiLSTM (Bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory) model.
explanations.representation learning: The paper's use of deep learning for EEG data involves learning representations of emotional states from raw data.
